item.title: Surgical Treatment for Inguinal Hernias
item.description: Currently, there are three common types of hernia repair surgeries Traditional Hernia Repair Surgery: Involves a 4 to 5 centimeter incision at the inguinal area, separating the hernia sac, and subsequently stitching and fixing a hernia mesh.

item.title: Is surgery necessary for inguinal hernias?
item.description: How should Hernias be treated? Inguinal hernias are protrusions of the peritoneum, and the only effective treatment is surgical repair.

item.title: What is inguinal hernia?
item.description: What is a “Hernia”? What is a “Hernia”? Hernia refers to organs being out of their normal position.
